intro: Euphrasia lanceolata proles catalaunica, commonly known as the Catalan narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its region.
